page.title: 15HOME LIFE IN WOLSTON 2.
page.content: A child wrote "Years ago, my{house was {a brewery.}It was built in 1810 and changed into a house in 1908. My bedroom was the loft and in my dad's workshop there is still a slit in the floor where they used to drain the barrels. Under my road, Brook Street, there are still cobbles." About his Saturday, a boy wrote "I woke up at 6.30 a.m. because the{hamster}was going mad on its wheel. I then got up at 9 a.m. to watch Scooby Doo and then got dressed and called for my friend. We played Ratatat Ginger: nearly got caught! Some more friends came to play Offground Tig and then we had lunch, a salad sandwich. My friends and I played follow my leader on{bicycles and went ten times round the block. I watched television all evening." Some children play on{roller skates,}or with dolls and a lot like horses.
